Module hanyaeger.api
Package com.github.hanyaeger.api.engine.entities.entity.motion

Class DefaultMotionApplier

java.lang.Object
com.github.hanyaeger.api.engine.entities.entity.motion.DefaultMotionApplier
All Implemented Interfaces:
DirectionProvider, LocationUpdater, MotionApplier, MotionModifier, SpeedProvider
public class DefaultMotionApplier
extends java.lang.Object
implements MotionApplier
A DefaultMotionApplier is an implementation of MotionApplier that does not abide the laws of Physics and only provides basis behaviour regarding speed and direction.

    • alterSpeedBy

      public void alterSpeedBy​(double increment)
      Description copied from interface: MotionModifier
      Alter the speed through addition. Using this method will increase or decrease the current speed. It will add the provided value to the current speed. Use a negative value to decrease the speed.
      Specified by:
      alterSpeedBy in interface MotionModifier
      Parameters:
      increment - A value greater than 1 will mean an increment in speed. A value between 0 and 1 will mean a decrement in speed.

    • multiplySpeedWith

      public void multiplySpeedWith​(double multiplication)
      Description copied from interface: MotionModifier
      Alter the speed through multiplication. Using this method will increase or decrease the current speed. It will multiply the current speed by the provided value.

      If it is required to set the speed to a specific value, use the method MotionModifier.setSpeedTo(double)}.

      Specified by:
      multiplySpeedWith in interface MotionModifier
      Parameters:
      multiplication - A value greater than 1 will mean an increment in speed. A value between 0 and 1 will mean a decrement in speed

    • setDirectionTo

      public void setDirectionTo​(double angle)
      Description copied from interface: MotionModifier
      Set the Direction. This value is in degrees, where
      • 0 means up
      • 90 means to the right
      • 180 means down
      • 270 to the left
      Specified by:
      setDirectionTo in interface MotionModifier
      Parameters:
      angle - the direction in degrees as a double

    • changeDirectionBy

      public void changeDirectionBy​(double rotation)
      Description copied from interface: MotionModifier
      Change the direction by adding a rotation in degrees. A positive value will be added and will result in a clockwise rotation. A negative value will be subtracted and will result in a counter clockwise rotation.
      Specified by:
      changeDirectionBy in interface MotionModifier
      Parameters:
      rotation - the rotation as a double

    • getDirection

      public double getDirection()
      Description copied from interface: DirectionProvider
      Get the direction in which the YaegerEntity is moving, in degrees. If the YaegerEntity is not moving, and therefore has no direction, this method will return NaN.
      Specified by:
      getDirection in interface DirectionProvider
      Returns:
      The direction in degrees as a double or NaN

      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • getPreviousLocation

      public java.util.Optional<javafx.geometry.Point2D> getPreviousLocation()
      Description copied from interface: MotionApplier
      Return the previous location. This Object is exposed to resolve an issue with the fact that collision detection occurs after all Entities are updated. If an Entity sets its speed to 0 on collision detection, it still received its last motion.

      Because of that it is impossible that halt an Entities movement if the user continues to press the movement buttons or another system is continuing to set the speed to a positive value.

      Specified by:
      getPreviousLocation in interface MotionApplier
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the Point2D representing the previous location of the Entity.
